conclusion: Determine the internal resistance of the silicon photocell when it is formed into a closed loop with the resistance R.
Find the intersection point of the voltage-current (U-I) characteristics of the photocell and the resistor.
Line a represents the U-I characteristic of the silicon photocell.
Line b represents the U-I characteristic of the resistor R.
The intersection point of lines a and b gives the voltage and current when the photocell and the resistor are connected in a closed loop.
From the figure, the intersection point is at U = 2.5 V and I = 0.2 A.
The internal resistance r of the photocell can be determined using the slope of the U-I characteristic line a.
The slope of the line a is given by the change in voltage divided by the change in current.
The slope of the line a can be calculated using the points where the line intersects the axes or any two points on the line.
The slope of the line a is the negative of the internal resistance r.
Line a passes through the points (0, 3.6) and (0.2, 2.5).
The slope is the negative of the internal resistance r, so r = 5.5 ohms.
The internal resistance of the silicon photocell is 5.5 ohms.
